benchmark_details.name: BAXBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: BAXBENCH is a novel evaluation benchmark consisting of 392 tasks for the generation of backend applications, focusing on their functionality and security. It includes 28 scenarios implemented in 14 backend development frameworks across 6 programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of large language models in generating production-quality backend applications that are both functionally correct and secure.

data.source: Generated by interacting with models based on defined scenarios in backend development.
data.annotation: Manual validation of code through functional and security tests.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the success rates of generated solutions in passing predefined functional tests and avoiding security exploits.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in generating secure and correct backend applications.
methodology.validation: Validated through a series of predefined tests that include both functional correctness and security vulnerability checks.
